meanings.definition: An upper part of a wall containing windows to admit light.
meanings.sent1: The clerestory in the cathedral allowed sunlight to brighten the room.
meanings.sent2: The architect designed the house with a beautiful clerestory for natural light.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous squirrel tried to peek through the clerestory to spy on the humans below.
meanings.sent4: Her smile was like a clerestory, bringing warmth and brightness to everyone around her.
meanings.sent5: As the sun set, the colors streamed through the clerestory, painting the walls with a golden glow.

meanings.sent1: She gazed out of the clerestory to enjoy the view of the city below.
meanings.sent2: The stained glass in the clerestory window cast colorful patterns on the floor.
meanings.sent3: The cat loved to nap on the soft cushion by the clerestory, basking in the sunlight.
meanings.sent4: His eyes were like a clerestory window, revealing his thoughts and emotions to all who looked.
meanings.sent5: The sound of rain tapping against the clerestory window was soothing and calming.
